Hi, I'm Alex O'Callaghan

computer science student

About me

My name is Alex O'Callaghan and I am a Computer Science undegraduate studying at University of Southampton. I love making websites and useful tools that help people. I use HTML, CSS and JavaScript (jQuery, Nodejs and AngularJS) to create beautiful websites and I am also experienced with Java (the language of choice in my Computer Science course).

You can find me on Twitter: @alexocallaghan,

have a look at some of my code on GitHub: awocallaghan on GitHub,

and I'm also on LinkedIn: Alex O'Callaghan on LinkedIn

Projects

FootyFeeds

FootyFeeds is a football news aggregator the gathers football news articles from popular RSS feeds. The website was created using Nodejs, Express, AngularJS and Twitter's Bootstrap as well as using a postgreSQL database.

Check it out

Crime map of London

For my EPQ A Level (Extended Project Qualification) I created a map of crime in London in 2013 using Google Maps API.

Check it out

example-express

I created a basic structure for a website using Nodejs and Express combined with a postgreSQL database for storing data. The project is open source aiming to help beginners with developing a Nodejs website

Check it out
